div.head: 物傷睛突
div.div: the eyeball is injured by a foreign object and protrudes

bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

entry.def: the eyeball is injured by a foreign object and protrudes

sense.def: Pathological Condition of an injury of an eye caused from outside by a foreign object with the eyeball protruding as major sign. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry di huang 地黃 quoting Sheng ji zong lu 聖濟總錄 112: 目 為外所傷，輕者因物撞擊，胞瞼腫痛，重者或致目睛突出，但眼帶未斷 , “When the eyes are injured by an impact from outside, in light cases the eyelids are swollen and ache as a result of a blow from a foreign object. In severe cases this may cause the eyeballs to protrude without severence of the eyeribbon”, writes: 物傷睛突：輕者瞼胞腫痛，重者目睛突出，但目系未斷 , “When the eyeball is injured by a foreign object and protrudes , in light cases the eyelids are swollen and ache. In severe cases the eyeballs protrude without the eye connection [with the brain] being severed”.
